bill_title: provide for disclosure of certain contents of public-private partnership agreements and to provide a penalty for failure to disclose.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for disclosure of certain contents of public-private partnership agreements and to provide a penalty for failure to disclose. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 1-27 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Not less than thirty days prior to any public body, as the term is defined in § 6-8B-1, entering into an agreement with a private person, firm, or corporation if the subject of the agreement is a project costing in excess of five hundred thousand dollars, and if the agreement provides for the private person, firm, or corporation to operate, control, or profit from the subject of the agreement, the public body shall make available for public inspection pursuant to the provisions of chapter 1-27: (1) The subject of the agreement; (2) The amount to be expended by the public body pursuant to the terms of the agreement; (3) The amount to be expended by the private person, firm, or corporation pursuant to the terms of the agreement; (4) The identity of the private person, firm, or corporation; (5) If the private firm or corporation has been in existence in this or any other state for fewer than five years, the identity of any person who has a financial interest in the firm or corporation; and (6) If the firm or corporation has been in existence in this or any other state for five years or longer, the identity of any person who has a five percent or greater ownership interest in the firm or corporation. Ownership interest of a person under this subdivision includes any interest held by that person, by a member of that person's immediate family as the term is defined in § 54-14-12, and by any other firm or corporation to which that person has an ownership interest. A violation of the provisions of this section is a Class 6 felony. Section 2. That § 1-27-1.6 be amended to read: 1-27-1.6. The following financial, commercial, and proprietary information is specifically exempt from disclosure pursuant to under §§ 1-27-1 to 1-27-1.15, inclusive: (1) Valuable formulae, designs, drawings Any valuable formula, design, drawing, computer source code or object code, and or research data invented, discovered, authored, developed, or obtained by any agency if disclosure would produce private gain or public loss; (2) Financial information supplied by or on behalf of a person, firm, or corporation for the purpose of qualifying to submit a bid or proposal, except as provided under section 1 of this Act; (3) Financial and commercial information and records or record supplied by a private persons person pertaining to export services; (4) Financial and commercial information and records or record supplied by businesses or individuals a business or individual as part of an application for loans a loan or program services service or application for an economic development loans loan or program services service; (5) Financial and commercial information, including related legal assistance and advice, supplied to or developed by the state investment council or the division of investment if the information relates to investment strategies or research, potential investments, or existing investments of public funds; (6) Proprietary Any proprietary data, trade secrets secret, or other information that relates to: (a) A vendor's unique methods of conducting business; (b) Data unique to the product or services of the vendor; or (c) Determining prices or rates to be charged for services, submitted by any vendor to any public body; (7) Financial, commercial, and proprietary information supplied in conjunction with applications an application or proposals proposal for funded scientific research, for participation in a joint scientific research projects project, for projects a project to commercialize scientific research results, or for use in conjunction with commercial or government testing, except as provided under section 1 of this Act; and (8) Any production records record, mineral assessments assessment, and or trade secrets secret submitted by a permit holder, mine operator, or landowner to any public body.
